result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Joseph Weber

records.addlTxt:
Asst. District Attorney Kevin Greene appears on behalf of the State. Defendant Charles Joseph Weber appears in custody, via Zoom. State Public Defender's Office has not appointed attorney for defendant. Victim requests no contact lifted. State objects. Court allows defendant to have contact with victim and children while in custody. Court allows defendant to attend medical appointments of his biological children when out of custody. All other conditions remain.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on no contact order on October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Golden House papers - Voluntary Request to Modify and/or remove a no contact release condition. 
10/17/2022, routed to Sally-Br 8 for review

GPS Exclusion Zone(s)
The original document was titled: Motion to Seal-GPS Exclusion Zones_1 - Weber, Charles Joseph.pdf
The original history event date is: 10-07-2022
Proposed GPS Exclusion Zone(s) and Motion to Seal

Defendant to have no contact with C.Z. or their residence or place of employment.
Third party may arrange child placement/visitation. 
GPS to be installed prior to release - Not to be within 1000ft of C.Z. or residence.

Defendant Charles Joseph Weber in court, in custody at Brown County Jail, via zoom.  Attorney Carrie J LaPlant in court for Charles Joseph Weber, via zoom.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Charles Greene in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
